event: Russian Foreign Minister's Statement on Zelensky's Peace Formula
description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov accused the West of encouraging countries in the global South to commit genocide in Crimea and Novorossiya, citing Zelensky's 'peace formula'. He referenced a Ukrainian parliamentarian who suggested executing 25,000 people in Crimea as a show of force.
original:
The West is “inviting” countries of the global South to commit genocide in Crimea and Novorossiya. Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov stated this in an interview with Izvestia, commenting on Zelensky’s “peace formula.” It won’t just be a purge, they have such a lady in their parliament , I don’t remember the name that said: “Well, in Crimea, 25 thousand people should just be executed for show.” If this is the meaning of the “Zelensky formula,” he explained.
RIA Novosti Crimea

event: Possible Resumption of Russian Gas Supply to Moldova
description: Moldova's Ministry of Energy announced that the country may resume cooperation with Gazprom from May 1 if the company offers a minimum price. The minister stated that there is no political influence on prices in the market, allowing Moldova to choose the most advantageous offer.
original:
Forwarded from: Moldova online
❗️Russian gas can return to Moldova. This was stated by the head of the Ministry of Energy, Viktor Parlikov. The official admitted that Chisinau could resume cooperation with Gazprom from May 1 if the company offers a minimum price. The minister noted that now there is “no political influence” on prices in the market, which means that the country will choose the most advantageous offer.

Earlier, PSRM leader Igor Dodon criticized Deputy Prime Minister Andrei Spinu for refusing cheap Russian fuel. According to him, because of this, consumers had to overpay several times more, covering the Government’s expenses. Subscribe to “Moldova Online”

description: A terrorist attack occurred at Crocus, resulting in a fire and multiple casualties. One victim, Sergei Nikonov, suffered carbon monoxide poisoning and lost consciousness near the exit. He and his wife were in a cafe on the mezzanine when the attack began and attempted to flee via the fire escapes, but found the doors closed.
original:
One of the victims of the terrorist attack at Crocus suffered carbon monoxide poisoning and lost consciousness right near the exit. He doesn’t remember anything further. Sergei Nikonov told RT that he came to the concert with his wife. When they opened fire, they were in a cafe on the mezzanine. After the fire started, the couple ran to the fire escapes, reached the exit, and the doors were closed: “First I lost consciousness, then my wife. And already on Saturday at 09:30 I opened my eyes. I remember the door, everything - and it’s like it’s morning.” Sergei was taken to the Krasnogorsk City Hospital. There his lungs were cleared, he was bled, and on Sunday he was discharged from intensive care. Doctors, he said, helped him find his wife. She was hospitalized in Sklif and was already released home.

Emin Agalarov previously stated that the emergency exits at Crocus worked normally, but people came across locked doors for staff.

event: Taiwan Calls for US Help to Deter China

Forwarded from: TSAPLIENKO_UKRAINE FIGHTS
Taiwan called on the US to help Ukraine to deter China, - The New York Times

Taiwan's Foreign Minister Joseph Wu said that the US withdrawal from military support to Ukraine will allow China to increase its propaganda that Washington is an unreliable partner.

According to Wu, if Russia succeeds in occupying most of Ukraine, it will be seen as a victory for authoritarian states, and then China, deciding that it can take advantage of Russia's strategy, will attack the island.

description: The SBU detained a Russian intelligence agent posing as a chaplain, who attempted to infiltrate the Ukrainian paratroopers to gather information on their locations, movements, and combat operations. The agent was recruited remotely by the 317th Intelligence Center of the Russian Armed Forces and was caught during an interview at the Ukrainian Paratroopers Command headquarters.
original:
Forwarded from: Security Service of Ukraine
The SBU detained a "mole" of Russian intelligence who, under the guise of a chaplain, tried to spy on paratroopers of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.
 
As a result of a special operation in Kyiv, a henchman of the Russian special service who tried to join the Ukrainian paratroopers under the guise of a chaplain was detained.
 
The agent wanted to "enroll" in one of the DSHV combat brigades in order to spy on its locations and movements in the direction of the front line.
 
In the future, the person involved was supposed to establish trusting relations with the command of the units of the airborne assault troops of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.
 
In this way, he hoped to expand his "capabilities" to collect data on the weapons, work plans and combat operations of the Ukrainian defenders.
 
However, SBU employees promptly exposed the "mole", identified its Russian curators and documented their intelligence activity.
 
The next stage was the detention of the person involved, when he was already undergoing interviews at the headquarters of the Ukrainian Paratroopers Command regarding "enrollment" in the ranks of the Armed Forces.
 
According to the investigation, the detainee turned out to be the chief specialist of one of the departments of the Kyiv Regional Military Administration.
 
The official was recruited remotely by a staff member of the 317th Intelligence Center of the Main Directorate of the General Staff of the Russian Armed Forces (known as the game).
 
In order to pass himself off as a chaplain, the man from Kyiv made a false "certificate" of alleged membership in the parishioners of one of the denominations.
 
Before that, the Russian special service gave him "trial" tasks even during his work in the military administration.
 
He maintained communication with the aggressor through an anonymous chat in the messenger.
 
During the arrest, a mobile phone with evidence of his correspondence with the Russian game was seized from the traitor.
 
Currently, the person involved has been notified of the suspicion under Part 2 of Art. 111 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (treason committed under martial law).
 
The perpetrator faces life imprisonment.

event: Suspended Sentence for Former Ministry of Internal Affairs Employee
description: Maria Titova, a former employee of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, was given a suspended sentence for organizing a gang to legalize migrants in Irkutsk. She used her official position to create an organized crime group, facilitating illegal migration and receiving bribes totaling over 1.2 million rubles.
original:
Forwarded from: Multinational
Humane Justice News.

In Irkutsk, the court gave a suspended sentence to a former employee of the Ministry of Internal Affairs who organized a gang to legalize migrants, although the prosecutor's office asked for a real sentence of 10 years.

We are talking about this lady, her name is Maria Titova.

In 2022, as the head of the organizational and methodological department of the Migration Department of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia for the Irkutsk Region, she created an organized crime group and, acting using her official position, together with a colleague entered into a criminal conspiracy with a number of civilians aimed at organizing illegal migration. The suspects created conditions for the illegal stay of foreigners in Russia and assisted them in passing an interview to become a native Russian speaker, in violation of the procedure provided for by law. Subsequently, this provided them with the right to unhindered and indefinite stay in Russia and to obtain Russian citizenship. Investigators of the Investigative Committee, in interaction with employees of the ORCh (SB) of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia for the Irkutsk Region and the Federal Security Service of Russia for the Irkutsk Region, established facts of receiving bribes totaling more than 1.2 million rubles (this is only from what has been proven).

The activities of the gang were identified and suppressed by the internal security officers of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs and the FSB, then investigators from the Investigative Committee and the FSB collected evidence, and a humane judge gave a suspended sentence, although the prosecutor’s office asked for a real 10 years. That's how we live.

event: Exhibition and Lesson on Tactical Medicine
description: Activists of the Volunteer Company held an exhibition of Russian military equipment and conducted a lesson on tactical medicine at the Chelyabinsk State Pedagogical University. They demonstrated the use of uniforms, showed the contents of a modern first aid kit, and discussed ways to stop bleeding. The volunteers also spoke about their organization's activities and humanitarian mission in Donbass.
original:
Activists of the “Volunteer Company” held a lesson on NVP at the Chelyabinsk State Pedagogical University named after. I. Ya. Yakovleva
Today, March 29, activists of the Chuvash branch of the Volunteer Company of the Combat Brotherhood held an exhibition of equipment of Russian military personnel. Our volunteers clearly showed how
Show more
what the uniform is used for.
The guys also conducted an introductory lesson on studying tactical medicine, showed the contents of a modern first aid kit, and talked about ways to stop bleeding.
At the end of the lesson, the volunteers spoke about the activities of the organization and the humanitarian mission in Donbass.
Separately, we note that all the equipment was provided from our friends from the “Defenders Team” (https://vk.com/defenderstore) - our Domestic equipment production.
#VolunteerRota
#Chuvash Republic
#MissionZ

description: Karen Yengibaryan, a parishioner of the Armenian Church, risked his life to save people from the burning Crocus building. He entered the building, helped evacuate people, and inhaled smoke, which eventually led to his death.
original:
The diocese told how a parishioner of the Armenian Church, Karen Yengibaryan, saved people in Crocus and died.

He arrived at the burning Crocus, responding to a friend’s request, gave his jacket to a man on the street, entered the building and helped people evacuate.

He stayed there for a long time, inhaled smoke, came out without a jacket and caught a cold.

When Yengibaryan arrived home, he felt worse, and on the second day his wife called an ambulance. He died in the hospital.

Last year, the Volnovakha municipal district became one of the winners of the All-Russian competition Formation of a comfortable urban environment. With the support and help of the chief of the Yamalma region, we developed a project to revive the Summer Park. Large-scale work awaits us, which will begin in April of this year. As part of the project, a comfortable urban environment for recreation, urban events in the field of culture, sports and ecology.

description: The Russian General Staff announced the spring conscription, starting on April 1, 2024, in all regions except some areas in the Far North. Conscripts will serve for 12 months and will not be sent to new deployment points. Military personnel who have completed their conscription periods will be promptly dismissed and sent home.
original: The deputy head of the main organizational and mobilization department of the General Staff spoke about the spring conscription starting on April 1: ▪️ It will take place from April 1 in all regions of Russia, with the exception of some regions of the Far North, where due to the climate they are called up for service from November 1 to December 31. ▪️The start of sending conscripts from assembly points is planned from April 15, 2024.▪️The term of military service under conscription will, as before, be 12 months.▪️Conscripts will not be sent to deployment points in new regions.▪️Starting from April 16, direct service will begin line where specialists will provide explanations on issues related to conscription.▪️All military personnel who have served the established conscription periods will be promptly dismissed and sent home.

description: As part of the 'Together for Victory' campaign, employees of the Gaide insurance company collected essential items for soldiers defending Russia. The initiative received widespread support from colleagues across various regions, demonstrating the company's commitment to helping military personnel.
original: As part of the campaign “Together for Victory - a Gift to the Defender of the Fatherland,” organized by the Russian Veterans Movement, employees of the Gaide insurance company expressed their support for the soldiers defending our Motherland. Having collected food, hygiene products, office supplies, batteries and flashlights, they demonstrate their concern for those who serve the country. The action received wide support: it was joined by colleagues from various regions of the company, including Moscow, St. Petersburg, Simferopol and other cities. The Hayde insurance company adheres to a policy of helping military personnel called upon to protect the interests of the Russian Federation . Their participation in the event is a vivid example of social responsibility and care for veterans and soldiers. The Russian Veterans movement expresses special gratitude to the employees of the company IC "Gaide" and wishes them reliable clients, professional success and fulfillment of their goals. Thank you for your active participation in this important and symbolic event!@veteranrossii_online

description: Sisters Olga and Sofia were in the hall when they heard gunfire during the terrorist attack on Crocus. They lay down between the rows, then fled, but got lost in the crowd. Sofia found herself face-to-face with the terrorist, but managed to escape. The sisters were eventually reunited after a panicked search.
original:
The sisters who escaped from Crocus told RT how they lost each other during the evacuation during the terrorist attack.
22-year-old Olga and 20-year-old Sofia were in the hall when they heard the sound of gunfire. The older one ordered the younger one to run, but the shooting began to intensify and the terrorists entered the hall. The girls lay down
Show more
between the rows.
When the sounds of gunfire began to get closer, the sisters and the others decided to flee. They managed to record a voice in the family chat and report what was happening. A couple of minutes later we got lost in the crowd - and the youngest found herself in full view of the terrorist.
“I took some girl with me. When I ran out, we went onto the escalator, it was still working. And the shooter came out. I realized that now he would shoot at us again. And I sat down and told the people who were nearby to sit down too,” recalls Sofia.
When Olga lost sight of her sister, she was seized with panic. My brother called and she said she couldn’t find Sofia. It turned out that someone passing by had already taken it:
“I thought that they were deceiving me so that I would calm down and get out too. Then my brother connected his phone with his sister’s phone so that Sofia and I could hear each other. Hearing her voice, I calmed down and began to get out myself.”
Holding back tears, Sofia admitted that the meeting with the terrorist left her very upset and she needed the help of a psychologist.
At (3:57) - footage taken before the shooting began, a voicemail that the sisters sent to their loved ones, as well as a photo of their meeting after the events in Crocus

event: Testing of Voevoda Vest and RPS
description: The general director of the Varyag company visited a training ground with their Voevoda vest, RPS, and pouches. The kit was designed based on recommendations from military personnel with combat experience. The author assembled the kit on-site to test its effectiveness.
original:
“Every doctor has his own cemetery”©... This aphorism fully applies to manufacturers of SIBZ. The unsightly side of progress and development which is not customary to talk about out loud. But these are the mistakes from which we learn, and the experience gained is transferred to new models of personal armor protection.
Just now the general director of the Varyag company came to our training ground, who brought with him his Voevoda vest, RPS and a large list of pouches.
The kit was created according to the recommendations of military personnel with experience in combat operations and wearing various types of armor protection in a variety of conditions. I specifically asked that the kit be delivered disassembled and that your humble servant, as the end user, assemble it on site.
It is not by chance that I started talking about irretrievable losses. Over two years of production, more than 500 sets of this product were manufactured for the advanced and 0 200s. Yes, this is not so much, but you will agree that the trend is positive, but in my opinion this is not an accident, but a well-structured approach based on experience, recommendations and the introduction of advanced technologies.
In the coming days I will talk about this kit and products from the Varyag company.#pandadialog#pandaphoto

A Russian tourist flight from Hurghada to Moscow was delayed due to a breakdown of the Airbus A320-200's on-board computer. The 180 passengers, including families with children and the elderly, were left stranded at the airport for over 12 hours with minimal assistance from the airport staff and tour operator Coral Travel.
original:
Forwarded from: SHOT
Russian tourists were stuck at Hurghada airport due to a breakdown of the plane's on-board computer. The flight was postponed several times: people have been at the airport for more than 12 hours.

According to SHOT, the Airbus A320-200 flight Hurghada - Moscow of AlMasria Universal Airlines was supposed to take off yesterday at seven in the evening. According to passengers, when he was already on the runway, they announced over the loudspeaker that the Airbus was broken down. There were about 180 tourists on board. They spent more than two hours on the plane, and then they were transferred to the airport. The airport staff reported that the on-board computer had broken down.

Among the passengers there are families with children and the elderly. The tour operator Coral Travel has not yet answered people’s questions, and airport workers have not even offered a hotel for this time. The only food they offered was a bun and water, the rest was only for money.

The most enterprising Russians, who found it uncomfortable or cramped to sleep on chairs, looked for more comfortable locations to spend the night, for example, a baggage inspection belt (pictured).

It is unknown when exactly the plane will be repaired. The new departure time has not yet been set. Subscribe to SHOTSend news

description: A secret report from the Royal Canadian Police predicts an apocalyptic future for Canada, foreseeing economic collapse, environmental crisis, and territorial disintegration. The country is becoming increasingly ungovernable, with a polarized society and unaffordable housing for young Canadians.
original:
Forwarded from: 360tv
Hunger riots and civil war. Canada is heading towards social catastrophe. A secret report from the Royal Canadian Police paints an apocalyptic future for the United States' northern neighbor, predicting that the country will face economic collapse, environmental crisis and territorial disintegration.

Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has been in power since 2015, but the report says the country is becoming increasingly ungovernable. Society is polarized. Canadians under 35 have virtually no chance of purchasing a home.

Canada has long relied on its natural resources and its industries are largely American. The real estate bubble continues to grow, and most of the decent jobs are in banking.

It is emphasized that this is not only a Canadian problem. It concerns all Western countries that live on borrowed time.

The report concludes with a "Next Steps" section, which has been completely redacted, sparking intense speculation about what the government plans to do. Subscribe to 360

description: The Moldovan government has agreed to sell the 5.2-hectare territory of the former Republican Stadium in Chisinau to the US Embassy for approximately 15 million euros. This deal aims to revitalize the entire sector of Chisinau, which has been abandoned for almost 17 years.
original:
Americans can buy the territory of the Republican Stadium for 15 million euros Moldova will sell the territory of the former Republican Stadium in Chisinau to the US Embassy for about 15 million euros. “The government has begun agreeing on a document that will begin the process of developing this site in the center of the capital, abandoned for almost 17 years, and will revitalize the entire sector of Chisinau,” the government said in a statement on March 29.

A plot of 5.2 hectares on Tighina Street will be sold to the US Embassy based on an agreement.

According to the government, the sale price will be about 15 million euros. But all the final details will be made public after the negotiators complete all the processes. Notebook Moldova Notebook Moldova Americans can buy the territory of the Republican Stadium for 15 million euros Long-suffering site in the center of Chisinau

description: A 26-year-old man was arrested for the intentional murder of his father in the village of Shativka, Loziv district, Kharkiv region. The suspect, who had prior legal issues, got into an argument with his father after drinking together, and then stabbed him multiple times with a kitchen knife, resulting in the victim's death.
location: Shativka, Loziv district, Kharkiv Oblast, Ukraine
original:
🔷A man who killed his own father was taken into custody 🖌️Under the procedural guidance of the Loziv District Prosecutor's Office of the Kharkiv Region, a 26-year-old man was informed of the suspicion of intentional murder (part 1 of Article 115 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine).

The tragic event happened in the village of Shativka of the Loziv district. According to the investigation, on March 26 of this year, the man, who previously had problems with the law several times, was visiting his father. The men drank alcohol together. An argument arose between them, during which the suspect grabbed a kitchen knife and threw it at the father.

The killer struck at least four times in the neck and about ten more in the relative's chest. The victim died at the scene from his injuries.

At the request of the prosecution, the suspect was remanded in custody.

The pre-trial investigation is being carried out by the Loziv RVP of the State Police in the Kharkiv region.

Note: in accordance with Art. 62 of the Constitution of Ukraine, a person is considered innocent of committing a crime and cannot be subjected to criminal punishment until his guilt has been proven in a legal manner and established by a court verdict. ⚔Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office

description: The Kaluga Scientific Library, in collaboration with the Office of the Russian Guard, organized a book collection campaign for the Central City Library of Pervomaisk in the LPR. Thousands of books, including fiction, scientific classics, and publications on history, cultural studies, philosophy, pedagogy, and psychology, were sorted and prepared for transfer as humanitarian aid.
original:
The LPR and the Kaluga region cooperate in the field of librarianship.
Kaluga Scientific Library named after. V. G. Belinsky continues to organize campaigns to collect literature for the Central City Library of Pervomaisk. Thousands of books have already been sent as humanitarian aid.
Show more
This time the book gift was prepared by the Office of the Russian Guard for the Kaluga Region. Volunteers and librarians helped sort collections of fiction, scientific classics and other publications on history, cultural studies, philosophy, pedagogy, and psychology. Soon the books will be transferred to the library of the sponsored city. Kaluga colleagues hope that the donated books will not only take their rightful place on library shelves, but will also delight new readers.
“Filling libraries with publications of classical and modern authors in Russian is a primary humanitarian and educational task. We plan to continue working to replenish the collections of libraries in friendly regions and, thereby, give the books that are stored on the shelves of our readers a second life,” noted the director of the Kaluga Regional Scientific Library. V. G. Belinsky Alla Akinina.
KALUGA REGION - PRESS SERVICE OF THE GOVERNOR AND GOVERNMENT

description: A pregnant girl, Yulia, shares her story of living in a combat zone since 2014. Her husband, a warrior, recently passed away. Despite the difficulties, she is determined to stay in Donetsk, where she and her husband had bought a house. She is concerned about leaving her cat and its kittens behind.
original:
Among them I notice a pregnant girl

“I’m here alone, my husband, may he rest in heaven, died recently.” He has been in the combat zone since 2014, since the time of the DPR militia, and my mother lives in the Lugansk region and cannot come here. My neighbors are good - grandmothers, already pensioners. Of course, we will be accepted everywhere in Russia, but how can we leave everything here? Moreover, my cat gave birth to six babies this night, how can I leave them? The cat also got into a fight and is jumping on three legs,” says Yulia.

She and her husband dreamed of a house in Donetsk and were recently able to buy it.

“We are both warriors, how can we not let our husband go if I am the same,” explains the girl. — Shortly before the SVO, we decided that after all, one person should serve in the family, and I went into civilian life

From training grounds where volunteers train to humanitarian aid in the Petrovsky district, my new report https://iz.ru/1674042/dmitrii-astrakhan/dazhe-vo-vremia-rotatcii-boitcy-ne-prekrashchaiut-trenirovki

description: Four militants, part of the Russian Armed Forces' Southern Military District, were captured during intense fighting in the Robotyny area of Zaporizhzhia. They were involved in repeated attempts to breach Ukrainian defenses on the eastern and southern fronts.

The attackers from the Donetsk, Lagun regions and Crimea were part of the occupation groups of the Southern Military District of the Russian Armed Forces.

In the ranks of the invaders, they were involved in "meat assaults" on the advanced positions of the Armed Forces on the eastern and southern fronts.

First of all, we are talking about the repeated attempts of the occupiers to "break through" the defenses of the Ukrainian defenders in the Robotyny area of Zaporizhzhia.

All four traitors were captured during fierce fighting.

As the investigation established, the two convicts are residents of the temporarily occupied parts of Donetsk and Luhansk regions.

Both voluntarily "mobilized" into the Russian army at the beginning of the full-scale invasion of the Russian Federation.

There, they were given automatic weapons with ammunition and assigned as shooters.

Two more convicts are residents of the temporarily occupied Crimea. They "enrolled" in the ranks of the invaders in the fall of 2022.

First, they were transferred to Berdyansk to equip Russian fortified areas and checkpoints.

Subsequently, both traitors were sent to the Robotyny district to storm the defense positions of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. According to the materials of the SBU, the court sentenced them all to 15 years in prison.

description: The former rector of Kharkiv University is suspected of paying an illegal salary to an acquaintance, who did not work at the university, from November 2019 to the end of 2021. The rector signed documents for the salary, despite the woman not having the required higher education documents. The investigation is ongoing, with the suspect facing charges of official forgery and illegal salary payment.
original:
🔷Kharkiv University lost money due to the payment of an illegal salary: suspicion was handed to the former rector of the Criminal Code of Ukraine), and on the fact of official forgery (Part 1 of Article 366 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine).

According to the investigation, from November 2019 to the end of 2021, the acting rector of one of Kharkiv universities organized a "scheme". He hired his acquaintance to work for him.

They "decided" that the woman would not visit the new workplace at all. At the same time, she will be credited with work experience and paid a monthly salary.

Over two years, the "worker" illegally received almost 250,000 hryvnias in salary.

The rector unreasonably signed documents for the salary of an acquaintance.

In addition, the official had no right to employ the woman for the position at all, because she did not provide any documents confirming that she had a higher education.

Currently, the question of selecting a preventive measure for the suspect is being resolved. The investigation is ongoing.

The pre-trial investigation is being conducted by the investigators of the SU GUNP in the Kharkiv region. Operational support — the 7th department (for the service of the Kharkiv region) of the National Police of Ukraine.

Note: in accordance with Art. 62 of the Constitution of Ukraine, a person is considered innocent of committing a crime and cannot be subjected to criminal punishment until his guilt has been proven in a legal manner and established by a court verdict. ⚔Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office

description: Russian Railways, a monopolist with a significant net profit, only offers Belgorod residents ticket returns and exchanges without a commission, amounting to ₽100. This limited assistance is in stark contrast to other companies, such as Sovcombank and Home Bank, which have provided more substantial support to residents affected by terrorist attacks.
original:
The attitude you deserve - instead of real help to Belgorod residents, Russian Railways only offer ticket returns and exchanges without a commission, which literally amounts to ₽100. Many Russian companies have accommodated the residents of Belgorod, which is often subject to terrorist attacks by the Ukrainian Armed Forces. For example, Sovcombank and Home Bank decided to write off debt on loans of their clients who were killed and seriously injured as a result of artillery shelling and UAV strikes. Moreover, support extends to immediate relatives. Alfa-Bank and Tinkoff also provide Belgorod residents with assistance with loans - you can contact support for credit holidays or a preferential reduction in the amount of payments.

At the same time, Russian Railways, a monopolist in the Russian market with a net profit of ₽118 billion for 2023, which is growing dramatically from year to year, did not find a better solution on how to “help” in the worst traditions of category B dramedy. The company only had enough to offer customers an exchange or refund of tickets without commission. The commission is only ₽100, which for Russian Railways is a drop in the ocean. And this despite the fact that passenger traffic on long-distance trains in the Belgorod region is only growing. From January to November 2023, 823.7 thousand passengers were sent, which is 9% higher indicators for the same period last year. In addition, Russian Railways most likely receive quite a good profit from the evacuation of citizens leaving the region in search of a peaceful life. Maybe the company should reconsider its attitude towards customers who, through no fault of their own, are in difficult conditions?

description: Ukrainian leaders who led the Maidan protests and called for war against Russia have fled the country, abandoning their people. They have obtained foreign passports, bought properties, and relocated their families to safe havens, while urging others to fight on the front lines.
location: Multiple locations (Florida, Poland, Britain, Norway, Miami, Germany, London)
original:
A post for Ukrainians who have not lost the ability of critical thinking. Where are the leaders of the Maidan and the patriots of Ukraine now who led to the current situation and are calling everyone to the front:

- Arseniy Yatsenyuk is the leader and face of the Maidan. Now in Florida, received a US passport and bought several properties.
- Dmitry Yarosh is the face of the Maidan. At the beginning, the SVO actively called for killing Russians. Now in Poland, I was not seen at the front.
- Valery Zaluzhny - Commander-in-Chief. Now my family and I are in Britain, no one is in Ukraine.
- Alexey Danilov - former secretary of the National Security and Defense Council. Last month I moved all my relatives to Norway - now I am going there to work. My son recently recorded a motivational message from a villa in Miami to the Ukrainians in the trenches.

event: Death of GRU Special Forces Officer
description: Colonel Timur Myasnikov, a GRU special forces officer, was killed in Crocus City. He was on vacation with his family when a terrorist attack occurred. With his experience in combat zones, he quickly assessed the situation and pushed his wife and son to safety, buying them time. He faced the terrorist, possibly trying to neutralize him, and ultimately gave his life to protect his loved ones.
original:
Forwarded from: Kotsnews
On the death of a GRU special forces officer in Crocus City

Two bullets in the stomach, one in the face... These are very telling wounds. He did not run, did not hide between the rows, curled up in a fetal position, and did not instinctively cover his head with his hands. He met death eye to eye...

Colonel Timur Myasnikov, a native of the 3rd GRU special forces brigade, came from the Northern Military District on vacation. I went to the concert with my wife and son. They left their daughter at home. He understood immediately what was happening. Experience. He fought in Tajikistan, Kosovo, Chechnya, Syria, Ukraine...

Seconds to make a decision. Pushes Polina and Ruslan into a safe space: “Run!” He himself turns to face the terrorist. What was there in those last seconds?

Maybe Timur simply covered his loved ones with himself, maybe he stepped towards the bastard to try to neutralize him. He bought time for his wife and son, remaining to the end a real Russian special forces officer who does not bend the knee to the enemy.

“Man. Even a MAN. Didn't mince words. Always stood up for his own people. Easy to communicate and behave.
A very competent officer, leader and commander,” an acquaintance succinctly described the deceased colonel to me in a military way.

Always stood up for his own... Eternal glory to the hero! @sashakots

description: Polish Deputy Minister Kolodziejczak disrupted negotiations with Ukraine by behaving inappropriately, taking off his headphones during the Ukrainian minister's speech and accusing the Ukrainian side of withdrawing from agreements. The Deputy Minister of Poland disrupted negotiations with Ukraine with his strange behavior - Ukrainian and Polish negotiators

Representatives of Ukrainian organizations participating in the negotiations claim that Kolodziejchak behaved inappropriately. In particular, he demonstratively took off his headphones when the Ukrainian minister spoke.

Representatives of Polish organizations confirm this information. Like, he was busy with everything except talking. The point of the deputy minister’s “outbreak” was the Ukrainians’ request for permission to transit grain through Poland. One of the participants in the negotiations said: “When we were already approaching the end of the negotiations, and Minister Sekersky left the hall for a while, Mikhail unexpectedly “attacked” the representatives of the Ukrainian delegation, who, I must admit, were very well prepared for this meeting. They pointed at presentations on how much grain they had contracted, and argued that they could not now break the agreements concluded a year ago, they wanted the Polish side to allow the transit of these hundreds of thousands of tons.” Later, Kolodziejczak, in an interview with Polish media, accused the Ukrainian side of withdrawing from the agreements.

"We had certain agreements, they were supposed to come into force on April 1, but now the agreement is being changed. This undermines trust in the Ukrainian side. Yesterday there were a lot of untruths about me in the media. I learned to negotiate since childhood. I know who has what goal persecutes. The Ukrainian side does not want to make concessions," Kolodziejczak said. We are confident that he will be even more effective in the event of negotiations with Russian tanks. Talent is wasted

Analysts say it will be difficult for Paris to exert a major influence in the conflict. France is capable of producing only three thousand shells per month, while Ukraine spends almost that much every day.
 
Moreover, if France wants to be effective, it needs to break through the front line, and this requires much more than 20 thousand people - which is exactly the number that France can prepare. Last summer, Ukraine attacked Russian defensive positions with approximately 60,000 forces, but without success. event: Delivery of New Tugboat to Baltic Fleet
description: The Baltic Fleet will receive a new road tugboat, 'Izhorets', of project 90600, which is currently undergoing state tests. The tugboat will perform tasks such as towing, berthing, refloating, firefighting, and oil spill cleanup as part of the Leningrad naval base.
original:
Forwarded from: Fuel Oil Soot
03/28/2024The Baltic Fleet will be replenished with a new tugboat. In the near future, the auxiliary vessels of the Baltic Fleet will be replenished with a new road tugboat “Izhorets” of project 90600. The tugboat is currently completing state tests.

During these tests, representatives of the manufacturer, together with the tugboat crew, conduct maneuvering and speed tests, check the operation of all units, systems and mechanisms. After completion of state tests, signing of the acceptance certificate and execution of the relevant documentation, the tug will become part of the Baltic Fleet and will begin performing tasks in accordance with its intended purpose as part of the Leningrad naval base of the fleet.

The tugs of this project are designed to perform towing and berthing operations in the port, roadsteads and coastal areas, refloat ships and vessels, as well as to extinguish fires, clean up oil spills and other functions. Press service of the Western Military District

event: Simplification of Combat Veteran Status Procedure
description: The Russian government has simplified the procedure for obtaining combat veteran status and uniform certificates for citizens who assisted the Armed Forces during the special operation in the DPR, LPR, Zaporozhye, and Kherson regions. The changes will benefit participants of the Northern Military District who lost contracts due to hostilities.
original:
↗In Russia, the procedure for assigning the status of a combat veteran and issuing uniform certificates has been simplified⚡️The government has simplified the procedure for obtaining the status of a combat veteran and a uniform certificate for citizens who were part of organizations assisting in the implementation of tasks assigned to the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation during a special operation, and also in the territories of the DPR and LPR from February 24, 2022, Zaporozhye and Kherson regions from September 30, 2022.⚡️The innovations will affect the participants of the Northern Military District who, as a result of hostilities, have lost their contracts with organizations facilitating the implementation of tasks assigned to the armed forces, or not were able to arrange them properly.

Until now, a copy of the contract was a mandatory basis for obtaining the status and certificate of a combat veteran. Now you can obtain veteran status without this copy, on the basis of:⚡️documents confirming wounds, injuries or concussions,⚡️documents on awarding a state or departmental award.❗️The President instructed the government to make appropriate changes following a meeting with family members of deceased SVO participants, held on 7 January 2024.@gorlovka- "Gorlovka. Today".#gorlovka

description: Ukrainian President Zelensky stated that he is willing to negotiate with Putin if Ukrainian forces reach the 2022 borders. He believes that once Putin loses the territories captured since 2022, he will lose confidence and power, becoming ready for dialogue.
original:
🤡Zelensky said that he was ready to negotiate with Putin before reaching the 1991 borders.

According to him, Putin will be “ready for dialogue” if the Ukrainian Armed Forces reach the borders of 2022.

“We will not need to de-occupy all our territories solely by military means. I am sure that when he loses what he captured starting in '22, he will completely lose the confidence of even those countries that still doubt whether to support Ukraine or not. And he will also lose power within his state. Once that happens, he will be ready for dialogue,” the president said in an interview with CBS.

He noted that to achieve such a result, “not only military steps” are needed on the part of Ukraine with a sufficient number of Western weapons, but also a complete trade blockade of the Russian Federation with the rest of the world.

“To win means to help Ukraine win economically, to be strong on the battlefield and to help politically. We will not need to de-occupy all our territories exclusively by military means,” Zelensky said. Uncle Slava. Subscribe.

event: Death of GRU Colonel Timur Myasnikov
description: GRU Colonel Timur Myasnikov died from three bullet wounds sustained during a terrorist attack in Crocus City Hall. He had pushed his wife and son to safety before coming under heavy fire. Myasnikov was a decorated veteran, having served in Ukraine, Tajikistan, and Kosovo.
original:
As a result of the terrorist attack in Crocus City Hall, a special forces colonel of the Main Directorate of Military Operations (GRUO) died, the death of military man Timur Myasnikov was reported by the telegram channel of graduates of Suvorov military schools and the head of the Samara branch of the Officers of Russia organization, Arthur Malivanchuk. Medizaona drew attention to the publication.

As Malivanchuk said, Myasnikov received three bullet wounds during the terrorist attack, from which he died a few days later. He claims that during the terrorist attack, the GRU colonel “managed to push his wife and son to a safe place, and he himself came under heavy fire.”

Myasnikov “served in the third special forces brigade, the General Staff of the Russian Armed Forces, and was awarded many military orders and medals,” Malivanchuk said.

The colonel came to Moscow from the combat zone in Ukraine a few days before the terrorist attack to see his family. Previously, according to Malivanchuk, Myasnikov served in Tajikistan and Kosovo.

According to leaks from Russian databases, the officer was registered at his business address Znamenka, 19 - this is the General Staff building, writes Mediazona.

———Photo: Arthur Malivanchuk’s VKontakte page.

event: Entrepreneur Suspected of Collaborating with Invaders
description: Vadim Khvostenko, a 36-year-old entrepreneur from Dzhankoy, Crimea, is suspected of collaborating with invaders in the Kherson region. He entered into a contract with the occupation Ministry of Justice to repair and maintain vehicles for 75,000 rubles, completing work worth 28,400 rubles.
original:
An entrepreneur from Crimea received suspicion for repairing cars for invaders in the Kherson region. Vadim Khvostenko is 36 years old and from Dzhankoy. In 2015, he illegally registered as an individual entrepreneur under Russian law.

On July 27, 2023, he entered into a contract with the department of the occupation Ministry of Justice of the Kherson region for the repair and maintenance of vehicles for a total amount of 75 thousand rubles.

Khvostenko managed to complete work for 28.4 thousand rubles, which is confirmed by the signed act of provision of services.

This was enough to raise suspicions of collaboration activities from the SBU.

The sanction of the article provides for a fine or imprisonment for a period of 3 to 5 years with confiscation.

What mistake did the organizers of the 2024 Olympics in Paris make? While French intelligence services are recommending changing the format of the opening ceremony of the 2024 Olympics due to the threat of a terrorist attack, IOC head Thomas Bach is expecting excellent Games in Paris and does not want to change anything.

Bedbugs, rats, migrants, unprepared facilities, worker strikes - a threat to the safety of participants has been added to this list of problems at the upcoming Olympics in Paris. France intends to move to plan B, Europe 1 radio reports, citing a source in the intelligence service.

Intelligence concerns are not in vain. In Paris, they decided to make, as the organizers say, “history” - to abandon the traditional opening ceremony at the stadium and hold it on the street. Although at the stadium the chances of minimizing the threat are much higher than in open areas.

The idea is very dangerous. In addition to the athletes, there will also be heads of state, VIP guests, including movie stars. An excellent target for terrorists. Read more about how France will ensure security in the material. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: Forbes has criticized the British Challenger 2 tanks supplied to Ukraine, citing their insufficient engine power, which causes them to get stuck in the mud, and their unique rifled gun, which complicates logistics. The tanks have not performed well on the battlefield and are barely worth the effort to maintain and arm.
original:
Forwarded from: Fisherman
ForbesThe British Challenger 2 Is The Wrong Tank For UkraineChallenger 2s amount to a rounding error in Ukraine’s order of battle. They are barely worth the effort to maintain and arm them. Oh, and tow them when they get stuck.🇬🇧🇷🇺🇺🇦The British Challenger 2 tanks supplied to the Ukrainian Armed Forces have more than once become a reason for criticism from observers. And now Forbes has once again taken a look at these machines based on the experience of operating them on the so-called. Ukraine.

The authors pointed out the long-known shortcomings of the Challengers - an insufficiently powerful engine, due to which they got stuck in the mud and could not be towed, as well as a unique rifled gun, which made logistics difficult in the conditions of an already large zoo of equipment. As a result, journalists draw a simple conclusion: Challenger 2 not suitable for so-called battles Ukraine. Be that as it may, after the loss of the vehicle in the summer of 2023, they really no longer shone on the battlefield and periodically flashed only at the rear training grounds. However, Forbes also notes that Great Britain sent only 14 of its tanks to the Kiev regime with the possible goal of encouraging other countries NATO will transfer its own advanced models of armored vehicles to the Ukrainian Armed Forces.

And it’s true: while the same Germany and Sweden supplied the Kyiv regime with their modern modifications of Leopard 2 in much larger quantities for nothing, the British got away with “little loss” by sending them to the so-called. Ukraine has only a dozen vehicles even without additional armor.#Great Britain#Russia#Ukraine@rybarSupport us

event: Dispute over Green Energy in Romania
description: Romanian officials, including Energy Minister Sebastian Burdugi and National Energy Regulatory Authority Chairman George Niculescu, disagreed on the country's green energy production. While the minister claimed 2,460 megawatts from 134 authorizations, the regulator stated that only 28 authorizations for 228 megawatts were accepted. The discrepancy is attributed to bureaucratic inconsistencies and a speculative enrichment scheme.
original:
Romanian officials quarreled over the topic of green energy and how to properly take it into account.

According to Romanian Energy Minister Sebastian Burdugi, the country produces 2,460 megawatts of electricity based on 134 authorizations for renewable sources.

But the chairman of the National Energy Regulatory Authority, George Niculescu, says that in fact only 28 authorizations for 228 megawatts have been accepted for implementation.

Moreover, in both cases these are not private opinions. Romania officially indicates in its acts exactly the ministerial estimate of 2,460 megawatts obtained from solar and wind generation, but the regulator reports that the reality is ten times less due to bureaucratic inconsistencies in the procedure for reserving capacity through the introduction of auctions and financial guarantees. In other words, a speculative enrichment scheme has been established through various kinds of bureaucratic tricks and trade not in physical electricity entering the country’s national energy system, but in permits for its production and obligations for its purchase.

The regulator believes that Romania has the prerequisites to reach the ministerial target, but for this to happen, speculators must be removed from the renewable energy sector, and economic standards guaranteeing the development of authorizations must be introduced for investors with serious intentions.Ziarul National - NationalANRE șah la Burduja blocaj la regenerabile - Ziarul NationalDeclarațiile ministrului Energiei, referitoare la ritmul extraordinar de instalare a fotovoltaicelor și eolienelor, au fost demontate chiar de președintele ANR

description: Dagestan shooter Dzhanem attempted to kill Yakov Baklanov, a Russian warrior, with silver bullets. However, Baklanov miraculously survived two shots, and in response, he killed his opponent with a single shot.
original:
Forwarded from: ⚔️🛡Last Russian
"Do you want to kill Baklanov?" This proverb appeared among the Chechens after a series of unsuccessful attempts on the life of a Russian warrior.
And it means: to propose to do something that is obviously impossible. Yakov Baklanov’s military career began in 1824, when he was 15 years old. Baklanov continued the glorious family tradition - his father at that time commanded a Cossack hundred in the 1st Don Cossack Regiment. The young Cossack first distinguished himself in 1828-1829 in the war with the Turks, as a result of which he earned the rank of cornet.

Nature generously gifted Yakov Baklanov. Possessing a two-meter height and a heroic physique, he threw the enemy into confusion with just his appearance. Baklanov invariably rushed into the thick of the battle, waving a heavy saber, which the Ottomans nicknamed “Batman-klych”, which means “pound sword”. The Cossacks said that he could cut a person in half.

However, Baklanov was distinguished not only by physical strength. His enemies considered him “bewitched,” although in fact he was not invulnerable. Baklanov repeatedly received wounds and concussions, but every time he returned to duty. The main secret of his victories was his unique personal philosophy. Baklanov's commitment to military affairs was rooted in deep religious feeling. This is how he himself described his military credo: “Faith in God, stealth of movement, speed, then a bold blow to the first instinct of the heart.”

Baklanov fought for the longest time in the Caucasus. Superstitious mountaineers nicknamed the Russian hero Dajjal, the devil in the flesh.
The famous Dagestan shooter Dzhanem wanted to carry out one of the attempts to kill Yakov.

He boasted that he had special silver bullets prepared for “Boklu-Shaitan”.

Having learned that the highlander would be waiting for him in ambush, Baklanov pondered for some time whether it was worth going the usual way to the high mound, from where he regularly surveyed the area beyond the Michuk River. There was a battery (fortification) left by the Russians, and then the areas controlled by the highlanders began. The next morning, Baklanov went to the mound - as he himself admitted, out of “boastfulness.” Both his soldiers and the enemies on the opposite side watched closely what was happening. Suddenly a shot rang out from behind cover. But a miracle happened. Although Baklanov was a defenseless target at that moment, Janem missed. Having descended into the battery, the Dagestani reloaded his rifle and fired a second time. This time, it seems, the mountain “sniper” lost his nerve - the bullet only pierced Baklanov’s coat without causing him any harm.

“At that moment I took my left leg out of the stirrup and placed it on the horse’s mane; Leaning his left hand on his leg, he touched the nozzle, fired a shot, and my opponent flew backwards into the battery: the bullet hit his forehead and went right through,” recalled Yakov Baklanov in his notes “My Combat Life.” – The troops, standing silently, burst out “Hurray!”, and the Chechens across the river jumped out from behind the rubble, in broken Russian mixed with their own, began to clap their hands: “Yakshy (good) Boklu! Well done Bocclou!”

Since then, Chechens have been repeating the saying “Do you want to kill Baklanov?” for many decades. They asked this question to braggarts who were proud of their marksmanship.

description: A criminal case was opened against the head of the Main Directorate of Capital Investments of the Ministry of Defense in Ukraine, suspected of acquiring unfounded assets. His wife was found to have undeclared funds worth 3.56 million hryvnia and had purchased luxury items, including apartments and cars, at significantly underestimated prices.
original:
One gets the impression that criminal cases are opened against Ukrainian politicians every day, but what’s the point? Or is this just a formality to somehow reassure the population and show the West that anti-corruption work is being carried out? From the recent one. In a criminal case under Article 368-5, Part 1 of Article 366-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine, it became known that the wife of the head of the Main Directorate of Capital Investments of the Ministry of Defense, suspected of acquiring unfounded assets, was found during a search to have undeclared funds worth 3.56 million hryvnia. The official was appointed to the position in January 2023. According to the investigation, in the period from June 18, 2022 to May 13, 2023, he acquired assets worth 13.86 million hryvnia, the legality of the grounds for acquisition of which has not been confirmed and significantly exceeds his legal income.

In September 2022, an agreement was concluded between the Hotel and Entertainment Complex Stolitsa LLC and the official’s wife for the purchase and sale of an apartment at a price of 3.62 million hryvnia and a parking space. At the same time, the cost was underestimated, and the real amount was transferred in cash. Apparently they just like to pay in wads of money. It doesn’t end there. On January 31, 2023, his wife acquired ownership of a Lexus LX 570 allegedly for 100 thousand hryvnia. According to the Kiev Scientific Research Institute of Forensic Expertise, the cost of the car is actually 1.5 million hryvnia.

Also, the wife of the corrupt official purchased a BMW 428I allegedly for (!) 10 thousand hryvnia. The real cost of the car was 18.8 thousand dollars (550 thousand hryvnia).

During a search, the woman was found to have funds worth 3.56 million hryvnia, as well as fiscal receipts for the purchase of household appliances for a total amount of 1.16 million hryvnia. What can I do, maybe she also wanted to exchange the check, in case the color doesn’t match the interior of the purchased apartment.

According to information from the State Register of Individual Taxpayers, from January to May 2022, a woman’s income is 199 thousand hryvnia. Suitable income, because you can ask your husband for a little more, but only government money. @stepnoy_veter

event: Decline in Trade between Iran and Russia
description: Trade turnover between Iran and Russia decreased by 17% to $4 billion at the end of 2023, mainly due to a 27.1% decline in Russian exports to Iran. The decline is attributed to Iran stopping wheat imports from Russia, as well as issues with payment systems and logistics.
original:
Why is trade between Iran and Russia declining? Wrote for Russian Forbes why trade turnover between Iran and Russia has fallen at the end of 2023. The general director of the Institute of Agricultural Market Studies, Dmitry Rylko, and the general director of the RusIranExpo group of companies, Alexander Sharov (@rusiranexpo22), helped to sort out the issue. Main points: ▪️The problem lies in Russian exports to the Islamic Republic. Trade between the two countries at the end of 2023 decreased by 17%, to $4 billion, but imports from Iran to Russia increased by 15.8%, to $1.29 billion. At the same time, Russian exports fell immediately by 27.1%, to $2. 7 billion, which led to the overall decline in trade indicators▪️The decline is due to the fact that Iran stopped buying wheat from Russia in 2023. Tehran purchased 3–4 million tons of wheat from Russia, paying on average $200–250 per ton, so it turns out that exports dropped by almost $1 billion▪️There are two reasons: 1. Good grain harvest in Iran 2. Non-transparent import schemes to the Islamic republic: it is possible that wheat did arrive from Russia to Iran through third countries and intermediaries, it’s just not reflected in the reporting▪️However, in general, the problems are much broader. The turning point year 2022, with a mass of visits to Tehran from Russia and loud statements about the development of cooperation, did not lead to the emergence of new categories of Russian goods on the Iranian market and did not change the structure of exports from Russia - the trade turnover still consists of 80% of grains with unstable wheat .▪️The key problem has not been resolved: the lack of an effective payment system for trading operations. Formally, transfer systems from Russia to Iran exist, but they are guided by the state exchange rate (in Iran there are two rates: market and state). As a result, with each transfer, a Russian businessman loses 20–25%. At such rates, carrying cash turns out to be more profitable than transfers ▪️Logistics remains another problem. If you transport goods to Iran through the Black Sea, you need to find a fleet that has nothing to do with Europe or the United States. If delivered through the Caspian Sea, then there are few ships, they are small-tonnage. Ground transport works poorly due to the lack of direct railway communication, there is a route through Central Asia, but the problem is the Kazakh transit rates▪️ At the same time, Tehran, on the contrary, is having success: Iranian goods are expanding their presence in the Russian market. For the second year in a row, the volume of imports from Iran has been growing: in 2021 it amounted to $978 million, and in 2023 - $1.29 billion.▪️Food still makes up more than 50% of Iranian imports, but the share of other goods is gradually increasing: chemicals, industrial materials, spare parts and building materials, porcelain stoneware, catalysts, spare parts for turbines. In other words, trade turnover between the two countries is gradually becoming more balanced due to the growth of Iranian imports, and non-raw materials.

Full article: https://www.forbes.ru/mneniya/509074-uzkij-koridor-pocemu-sokrasaetsa-torgovla-mezdu-iranom-i-rossiej@irandezhurniyForbes.ru Narrow corridor: why trade between Iran and Russia is declining Despite all the talk on strategic partnership, trade turnover between Iran and Russia at the end of 2023 decreased significantly. Expert of the Russian Union...

description: Leonid Pasechnik met with Federation Council Senator Darya Lantratova to discuss joint actions to address the problems outlined by Vladimir Putin in his February message. They focused on strengthening integration processes in areas such as social protection, economy, and development of industrial enterprises, small and medium-sized businesses, and infrastructure.
original:
Forwarded from: Leonid Pasechnik
We discussed joint actions to solve the problems outlined by Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin in his February message with Federation Council Senator from the LPR Darya Lantratova. It is extremely important for the residents of the republic that the President paid special attention to the development of new regions.

We have already managed to strengthen integration processes in various areas – from social protection to the economy. This became possible thanks to the constant assistance of the federal authorities, fraternal regions-chefs and our large country as a whole.

Among the priorities for further joint work are the development of industrial enterprises, small and medium-sized businesses, continued modernization of housing and communal services facilities, hospitals, kindergartens, schools, sports and cultural institutions. We will pay great attention to supporting families with children, increasing the birth rate, youth development and personnel training. The most important vectors of work remain comprehensive support for SVO participants and their families, as well as the creation of an accessible environment for people with disabilities.

I thank Daria Sergeevna and her team for their constant active attention to our region and its residents! We still have many issues that we can resolve only in close coordination. I am sure that together we will cope with everything.

description: Nazrimad Lutfulloi, a 23-year-old Tajik national, was arrested in connection with the terrorist attack on March 22 at Crocus City Hall. He admitted to violating public order but denied involvement in the attack. He was sent to a pre-trial detention center for two months.
original:
⚡️The ninth detainee was arrested in connection with the terrorist attack on March 22 at Crocus City Hall. He doesn't speak Russian. His name is Nazrimad Lutfulloi. Until May 22, the Basmanny Court sent Nazrimad Lutfulloi, the tenth suspect in the terrorist attack in the Crocus City Hall near Moscow, to the pre-trial detention center.

He didn't speak Russian. Through an interpreter, he said that he was born in January 2000 in Tajikistan, not married, no children, and does not work. He lived in a hostel near the Shchelkovskaya metro station. He admitted his guilt only to the fact that he had violated public order at the Crocus City Hall on March 23, the day after the terrorist attack. The police asked him to show his passport, and he allegedly swore obscenely and repeatedly in response. The Preobrazhensky court arrested him for 15 days, as follows from the website protocol.

But now he has been charged with a terrorist attack. The appointed lawyer supported the investigation's request to close the meeting. After which the journalists were taken out of the hall.

The judge issued an arrest order for two months.⬛️Novaya Gazeta on Friday published its questions to the investigation in the case of the terrorist attack in Crocus. Without answers to them, it is unlikely that the crime can be considered solved. The list of questions is here. Photo: Novaya Gazeta

description: Ukrainian prisoner of war Andrei Panchishin revealed that he was forced to join the army despite having hepatitis C. He underwent training in Zhitomir and was sent to the front lines, where he was captured in Kleshcheevka. Panchishin stated that many Ukrainian soldiers are reluctant to fight and are threatened with prison if they refuse.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian Ministry of Defense
Captured serviceman of the Armed Forces of Ukraine: they did not plan to give a salary, why do corpses need money? “I was caught on the street and forced to join the army. And at the same time they told me to sign the contract. I had hepatitis C, but they didn’t pay attention to it and still sent me to war,” said Ukrainian prisoner of war Andrei Panchishin.

After the military registration and enlistment office he was sent to Zhitomir, where he underwent training for a month. After this, Panchishin and his colleagues from the 80th separate air assault brigade were sent to their positions. “Many do not want to go and refuse, they have a difficult psychological state. Those who refuse to go to war are threatened with prison and told that they will be imprisoned. There are many losses in the 300s and there are also 200s,” added Andrei Panchishin.

Panchishin, together with his colleagues, stayed in position for about five to six days.

“They took me in Kleshcheevka at one of the hot spots. When we went on a mission, we were told that it was good there, it was calm, but it turned out that everything was the opposite there. After we were surrounded, they threw a grenade into the basement and asked us to surrender. After that we immediately agreed that we were giving up. After that, we left the basement with our hands raised without weapons and surrendered,” Andrei shared the details of his captivity. “I was given a salary only for the time I was training, for a month - it was more than 20 thousand. And I don’t know yet about the positions I was there; it hasn’t come to me and is unlikely to come. Most likely, they didn’t plan to give a salary, because what do corpses need money for,” said the Ukrainian prisoner of war.

According to the prisoner, people are very tired of the conflict: “I believe that no one needs this war, it is most likely America’s war,” says Panchyshyn. He turned to other Ukrainians and urged them not to join the ranks of the Armed Forces of Ukraine: “ To those who are planning to be mobilized: guys, don’t go to this bloody war, because it doesn’t solve anything here, you’ll just die, and that’s it, you can’t do anything here.” Russian Ministry of Defense

description: The Central Bank has alerted entrepreneurs about a new fraud scheme where scammers pose as Federal Tax Service employees, sending emails demanding tax returns and asking for personal information and card details.
original:
The Central Bank has warned about a new fraud scheme: it threatens entrepreneurs. Fraudsters are constantly coming up with new tricks to deceive gullible citizens. Now they have begun to pose as employees of the Federal Tax Service. “The scheme is built on a campaign for filing tax returns and poses a threat to a large number of people and individual entrepreneurs,” the Central Bank said.

The scheme the attackers use is simple. They send emails allegedly on behalf of Federal Tax Service employees and demand that you submit a declaration using a special link. The potential victim is then asked to enter personal information and card details, ostensibly for identification.

The Bank of Russia warned that tax officials do not send out such letters, and reminded that citizens must independently file income declarations for the past year.

event: Public Discussion on Autism Treatment Guidelines
description: Public discussions on a new draft of clinical guidelines for autism spectrum disorders are ending on the Ministry of Health's portal. The proposed guidelines are concerning, as they suggest using haloperidol, which can lead to irreversible side effects, and dismiss proven effective methods as 'harmful'.
original:
In Russia, new rules for the treatment of children with autism spectrum disorders may be adopted - absolutely unscientific and dangerous for patients. On March 29, public discussions on a new draft of clinical guidelines for autism spectrum disorders (ASD) are ending on a special portal of the Ministry of Health. It is important that clinical guidelines are essentially not recommendations at all, but an official document, according to which the doctor is obliged to carry out diagnosis and treatment.

✹ A new project suggests giving children haloperidol - it leads to irreversible side effects. The authors don’t even mention safer alternatives.

✹ Methods of working with ASD that have proven effectiveness are called “in some cases harmful” in the document. They also suggest that all people with autism have reduced intelligence (this is a misconception).

✹ The authors of the document - the Russian Society of Psychiatrists - are not trying to legitimize their anti-scientific vision of autism. It didn’t work out the previous time, but now revenge is possible, because according to the law, recommendations must be reviewed every three years to include advanced treatment methods.

“Medusa” tells the story of what the approval of this dangerous project, which some doctors call “a return to the Stone Age,” could lead to.

———Open the material without VPN.MeduzaIn Russia, new rules for the treatment of children with autism spectrum disorders may be adopted...On March 29, public discussions on a new draft of clinical guidelines for autism spectrum disorders will be completed on a special portal of the Ministry of Health...

event: Suspended Sentence for Former Ministry of Internal Affairs Employee

original:
Forwarded from: Multinational
Humane Justice News.

In Irkutsk, the court gave a suspended sentence to a former employee of the Ministry of Internal Affairs who organized a gang to legalize migrants, although the prosecutor's office asked for a real sentence of 10 years.

We are talking about this lady, her name is Maria Titova.

In 2022, as the head of the organizational and methodological department of the Migration Department of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia for the Irkutsk Region, she created an organized crime group and, acting using her official position, together with a colleague entered into a criminal conspiracy with a number of civilians aimed at organizing illegal migration. The suspects created conditions for the illegal stay of foreigners in Russia and assisted them in passing an interview to become a native Russian speaker, in violation of the procedure provided for by law. Subsequently, this provided them with the right to unhindered and indefinite stay in Russia and to obtain Russian citizenship. Investigators of the Investigative Committee, in interaction with employees of the ORCh (SB) of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia for the Irkutsk Region and the Federal Security Service of Russia for the Irkutsk Region, established facts of receiving bribes totaling more than 1.2 million rubles (this is only from what has been proven).

The activities of the gang were identified and suppressed by the internal security officers of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs and the FSB, then investigators from the Investigative Committee and the FSB collected evidence, and a humane judge gave a suspended sentence, although the prosecutor’s office asked for a real 10 years. That's how we live.

❗️🇷🇺🇺🇦Donetsk direction: advancement of the RF Armed Forces in the center of Georgievka, situation as of 15:00 on March 29, 2024, Russian units are advancing in Georgievka along Lenin and Gagarin streets in the direction of the western outskirts of the village.▪️According to the latest data, the school building has been transferred to the full control of the RF Armed Forces kindergarten, where previously a few weeks there were positions of Ukrainian formations.▪️The enemy retreated to the territory of the former agricultural enterprise “Selkhozkhimiya” - there were several surviving buildings suitable for defense. On its western outskirts, the Armed Forces of Ukraine created a network of trenches to move manpower.▪️To the north of the settlement, the enemy retains control over the Krasnogorovsky reserve, to the south of which units of the Russian Armed Forces are consolidated in the forest belt.

Further advancement to the west without “pulling up” the northern flank and taking control of the dominant heights is difficult, so it is logical to expect attempts by the Russian Armed Forces to attack precisely in this sector. High resolution mapEnglish versionIf you have additions to the situation, you would like us to highlight the successes Your department, - You can always write to us in the feedback bot@rybar_feedback_bot.#Donetsk#Georgievka#Russia#Ukraine@rybarSupport us

description: Zakhary Kalashov, also known as Shakro Molodoy, a notorious Russian crime boss, was released early from IK-2 prison in the Krasnodar Territory due to health reasons. He was taken from the colony in a Gazelle truck and accompanied by a black Haval sedan with 'strong people' on board.
original:
Thief in law Shakro Molodoy left prison early Zakhary Kalashov (aka Shakro Molodoy) is one of the most famous crime bosses in Russia. The fact that he was released from IK-2 in the Krasnodar Territory was reported by the Shot telegram channel, close to Life. The information was confirmed by law enforcement agencies, writes TASS.

As Shot suggests, 71-year-old Kalashov was taken from the colony in the back of a Gazelle truck without FSIN identification marks. At the same time, a black Haval sedan drove out of the colony parking lot, which, according to Shot, had been parked near IK-2 for several days. It is alleged that when the Haval drove away from the colony, there were “strong people” in the cabin. Both the Gazelle and the sedan drove towards Krasnodar.

On March 13, the Ust-Labinsky District Court in the Krasnodar Territory granted Zakhary Kalashov’s request for early release for health reasons.

———

Zakhary Kalashov was detained in connection with extortion in July 2016. A court in Moscow in March 2018 sentenced him to nine years and ten months in a maximum security colony.

After the crime boss Ded Khasan (Aslan Usoyan) was killed in 2013, Shakro Molodoy began to be called “thief in law No. 1 in Russia.” TelegramSHOT⚡️Source: Shakro Molodoy was released on parole from the Krasnodar maximum security colony. In total, “Thief in Law No. 1” Zakhary Kalashov served about six years. Always...VIEW MESSAGE

event: Replacement of Caliber with Kh-101 Missile
description: The Kh-101 missile has replaced the Caliber missile as the primary cruise missile in the Northern Military District. The Kh-101's larger size, longer wingspan, and air launch capabilities give it a significantly longer flight range and more fuel capacity compared to the Caliber. Additionally, the Kh-101's stealth design and advanced navigation system make it more effective at breaking through enemy air defense.
original:
You can’t fool physics: or why the Kh-101 missile replaced the “Caliber”... We noticed that if at the beginning of the Northern Military District our main cruise missile was the “Caliber” launched from ships, today they have completely given way to the air-launched Kh-101 missile . And not by chance. The main limiting factor in the production of both missiles is the engine (both have a turbofan-50 engine). But the "Caliber" must fit into the standard 533-mm torpedo tube of the submarine, and hence its dimensions, which are somewhat smaller than those of X-101 (diameter 742 mm). And this is a lower flight weight (1770 kg versus 2300 kg). Moreover, in order for the rocket to stay in the air, the X-101 has a longer wingspan than the "Caliber" (4 meters versus 3.1 meters, respectively). An important argument is the air launch of the X-101, which means that fuel is not wasted on the initial acceleration of the rocket.

As a result, the Caliber has only 560 kg of fuel on board, and the X-101 has 1250 kg (in the basic version). And therefore it turns out that almost the same type of missiles (with approximately the same warhead power of 400 kg) have fundamentally different flight ranges (5,500 km for the Kh-101 and 2,000-2,500 km for the Caliber). The third important parameter is stealth and the ability to break through enemy air defense. The X-101 has no restrictions on its shape and was able to give it a shape with less radar signature. And a more advanced navigation system allows the X-101 to fly lower than the Caliber (30 meters and 50 meters, respectively). It also has a unit for shooting IR traps to deceive enemy anti-aircraft missiles. And all this makes this missile much more successful in breaking through enemy air defense.

This is what they have been demonstrating lately.

That is, the X-101 has more potential for modernization, as proved today. Moreover, even with a warhead of 800 kg, the X-101 flies much further, hits much harder and is much better able to break through enemy air defense.

And hence what we see. “Calibers” are almost never used in attacks on Ukraine, and the entire burden of attacks on enemy rear lines (in this segment) was shouldered by the now modernized X-101...

description: The Verkhovna Rada Committee on National Security, Defense and Intelligence reviewed 4,269 parliamentary amendments to the draft law on mobilization. The committee will now work on additional amendments and create a final comparative table before submitting the bill for consideration in the second reading.
original:
The relevant committee reviewed all 4,269 parliamentary amendments to the draft law on mobilization. The Verkhovna Rada Committee on National Security, Defense and Intelligence has completed its consideration of amendments submitted by people's deputies to the draft law on mobilization, said the head of the committee, Alexander Zavitnevich.

At the same time, this does not mean that the document is finally ready for consideration in the session hall of parliament.

Now members of the National Security Committee will work on additional committee amendments and create the final comparative table.

The document will also have to undergo examination by the main legal department of the Parliament.

And only after this the bill will be submitted for consideration in the second reading.Subscribe/Eng Twitter/YouTube/Eng Telegram
