description: The people of Mariupol gathered to discuss the priorities of rebuilding the city after de-occupation. The meeting, attended by over 40 residents, focused on the Rapid Action Plan and the main stages of the 'Mariupol Reborn' project. Participants defined key priorities, including security, housing, work, and overcoming social conflicts.
original: 🇺🇦The people of Mariupol discussed the priorities of rebuilding the city after de-occupation👏A new wave of dialogue meetings and workshops "I am Mariupol: I have to live!" has started. The first discussion was held in Kyiv." Now, together with leading experts and international partners, we are working on the development of a large Plan for the revival of the city after deoccupation "Mariupol Reborn". One of its components is the Rapid Action Plan. This is a step-by-step action plan to stabilize the situation and prepare the foundation for rebuilding. In particular, the restoration of critical infrastructure, key services, etc. The best architects are also working on spatial solutions for the city. But we need the opinion of the Mariupol residents themselves, their vision of the future of Mariupol. Our goal is to rebuild a city by the sea in which to live comfortably," he emphasized Mayor of Mariupol, Vadym Boychenko. During the meeting, which was attended by more than 40 Mariupol residents, Mayor Vadym Boychenko spoke in detail about the Fast Recovery Plan after the deoccupation - "Fast Recovery Plan" and the main stages of "Mariupol Reborn". Afterwards, the participants had the opportunity to work in groups and together define the priorities that require priority attention immediately after the de-occupation of the city. Among the most important: security, housing, work and overcoming social conflicts." We have a very large community of Mariupol residents who currently live in various cities of Ukraine, we maintain contact with them. We asked them whether it is time to think about recovery, they said that it is very important for them. They want to understand that there is a future for them, that someone is taking care of this future, and they want to participate in the design of this future," said the director of communications of SCM, a member of the supervisory board of the NGO "Mariupol Reborn" Nataliya Yemchenko. ✅Such meetings will be held in all cities where "Ya Mariupol" centers operate.▶️The Mariupol Reborn project is implemented by the Mariupol City Council with the investment support of SCM Rinat Akhmetov.

event: Ukraine and USA Agree on Debt Postponement
description: Ukraine and the USA signed an agreement to postpone payments on Ukraine's national debt. The agreement, signed by Minister of Finance Serhii Marchenko and US Ambassador Bridget Brink, aims to reduce the debt burden on Ukraine's state budget and redirect funds to social and humanitarian needs.
original:
Forwarded from: In the Center of Events | News
Ukraine and the USA agreed on the postponement of payments on the national debtUkraine and the USA signed an agreement on the postponement of payments on the national debt.
 
The corresponding agreement was signed by Minister of Finance Serhii Marchenko and Ms. Bridget Brink, the US Ambassador to Ukraine.
 
"Signing this agreement will reduce the debt burden on the state budget and direct the funds that were supposed to be paid for the repayment and servicing of debt obligations to the needs of the social and humanitarian spheres," Marchenko emphasized.
 
It is noted that the conclusion of the specified agreement was provided for by the Memorandum of Understanding on the suspension of payments on the state debt with a group of official creditors of Ukraine from the countries of the "Big Seven" and the Paris Club. This will allow Ukraine to suspend payments on the national debt until the end of March 2027. In the Events Center🇺🇦

description: The Main Organizational and Mobilization Directorate clarified that conscripted military personnel will not participate in the special military operation. However, they may be involved in tasks to cover the state border, including protecting the water area. Some conscripts may sign contracts to become professional military personnel.
original:
Forwarded from: 338
From conscription to conscription, the Main Organizational and Mobilization Directorate has to be reminded of the same thing: conscripted military personnel do not take part in a special military operation, and there are no plans to involve them in carrying out tasks in the combat zone. It is possible to involve them in carrying out tasks to cover the state border, including including the protection of the water area - there were precedents, and military personnel serving under conscription then showed high training, courage and bravery. But there is no talk of participation in hostilities in the special operation zone

Yes, a certain proportion of those who serve will sign contracts and become professional military personnel

But if over 1,600 people sign contracts with the RF Ministry of Defense and other departments every day, and sign them with the purpose of participating in hostilities, then the question is obvious: is it necessary to involve “conscripts” in carrying out tasks in the Northern Military District zone? TACCC The General Staff stated that conscripts will not be involved to participate in the special operation, Chief of the Main Organizational and Mobilization Directorate of the General Staff of the Russian Armed Forces, Colonel General Evgeniy Burdinsky noted that the sending of the young...

description: A malfunction in equipment caused a power outage in the Nevsky district, affecting around 100 houses, residential buildings, kindergartens, and shops. Crews were dispatched to resolve the issue, and backup power supply circuits were created. The power supply has since been restored.
original:
About 100 houses in the Nevsky district were left without electricity this evening. Residents started calling the emergency lights about an hour ago - electricity had not yet appeared.

In the area, entire residential buildings, kindergartens and shops have gone out, subscribers report. The reason for this was a malfunction in the equipment, Rosseti Lenenergo told us. Tanks were delivered to Kyiv without additional dynamic protection, which made the tank vulnerable to conventional cumulative ammunition. Weight.
The large mass of the tank does not allow it to operate effectively on the soft ground of the Ukrainian theater of operations (pictured), and the installation of dynamic protection would add several more tons to the weight of the tank. The combat weight of Challenger 2 is 62.5 tons, the Russian T-72B3 is 46.5 tons .Gun. The rifled barrel of the 120-mm cannon of the Challenger 2 tank can withstand no more than 500 shots, while the T-72B3 smoothbore has a service life of up to 1200 shots.#Ukraine@new_militarycolumnist

description: The Northern Fleet command group, consisting of the Brest and Snezhnogorsk ships, conducted anti-submarine training in the Barents Sea. original:
Forwarded from: Russian Navy🇷🇺|ZOV|🇷🇺Navy Of Russia
The Northern Fleet command group, consisting of the Brest and Snezhnogorsk ships, conducted training in the Barents Sea to search for submarines.

The training took place in cooperation with Il-38 anti-submarine aircraft of the Northern Fleet mixed aviation corps.

The exercise took place in a bilateral format - the anti-submarine sailors were opposed by the crew of one of the nuclear submarines of the Northern Fleet.

During the exercise, the crews of small anti-submarine ships will also conduct a series of joint training on the practical use of anti-submarine weapon systems against a simulated underwater target.

The Brest and Snezhnogorsk MPKs are armed with AK-176M and AK-630M anti-aircraft artillery systems, RBU-6000 rocket launchers and 533-mm torpedo tubes, as well as modern sonar systems. Designed to search, track and destroy submarines in the near sea and coastal zone.

description: Russian designers have developed the Joker-10 FPV drone, a kamikaze drone that explodes upon impact. It features remote detonation capabilities and can be activated by a timer, impact, or pilot command. The drone is equipped with a device that allows it to be remotely turned on or off, enabling covert deployment and minimizing detection risks.
original:
The Joker-10 drone, which explodes when it hits the enemy, was created in Russia. Russian designers have developed the Joker-10 FPV drone with a remote detonation method. The drone is already being used in a special military operation zone.

As Dmitry Kuzyakin, general director of the development company Center for Integrated Unmanned Solutions, told RIA Novosti, the drone is equipped with a device capable of remotely completely de-energizing or turning on the drone at a distance.

Thanks to this technology, the crew of Russian FPV drone operators can go to the launch position, install “switched off” “Jokers” and leave without fear of being detected by electronic intelligence of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. In addition, the device is equipped with the function of automatic approach and landing in a positional area.

At the operator's command, the kamikaze drone is activated. The electric detonator driver is triggered either by a timer, or by an impact, or by the pilot’s command. It will also work if you try to destroy it or cut the wires.

event: Z-Office Adviser Comments on French Troop Deployment
description: Mikhail Podolyak, adviser to Zelensky's Office, expressed skepticism about French troops' ability to withstand Russian air bombs in Ukraine. He emphasized that the war is not an expeditionary action and requires specific tasks, parities, and mathematics. Podolyak highlighted the dominance of Russian tactical aviation using guided bombs and the need for appropriate weapons to counter it.
original: ❗️Z-Office doesn’t believe that French troops will be able to withstand the strikes of Russian air bombs🔴On Bankova they don’t understand what problem the French want to solve if they send in their troops. The war in Ukraine is not expeditionary action, which the French are accustomed to conducting, and it is far from a fact that they will be ready to be on the front line, receiving Russian guided bombs on their heads.🗣 “What problem do you want to solve? War is specifics, specific tasks, specific parities, specific mathematics. If you don’t see the specifics, then what tasks will you solve? It is obvious to us today that at this stage there are quantitative indicators of the Russian Federation, how much of what it uses. For example, everything that happens at the forefront today depends on the dominance of tactical aviation, which uses guided bombs in huge quantities, and this is know-how that is 4-5 months old. And in order to remove this dominance, you need the appropriate weapon - this is either front-line air defense, or aviation with a certain range. If you don’t have this, then what tasks will this or that national contingent solve? Is he, the one who comes with his weapons, psychologically ready for the type of war that we have today? description: Russia plans to establish a BRICS grain exchange, which will strengthen its geo-economic influence as a major supplier of grain and fertilizers. This move will impact traditional grain and fertilizer exporting countries, forcing them to find alternative markets and compete with Russian grain.
original:
“A blow to Western exporters”: Russia will create a BRICS grain exchange Russia intends to create a BRICS grain exchange, and this will be a shock for the global agricultural market, writes the South China Morning Post.
 
The BRICS grain exchange will strengthen Moscow's geo-economic influence, strengthening its status as the most important supplier of grain and fertilizers. For BRICS members, the grain exchange will help ensure a stable flow of grain amid disruptions in global supply chains and problems with food shortages.
 
For traditional grain and fertilizer exporting countries such as the USA, Canada and Australia, the BRICS grain exchange will lead to the need to look for alternative markets for their products. They will face difficulties maintaining their market share and competition from Russian grain. Thus, Russia is expected to export a record 56% of the 2023-2024 wheat harvest for the post-Soviet era, while for the United States this figure will be only 39% - below the average of 50%.🔶Foreign Media - the main international

description: A pipe break in Engels caused a massive sewage flood, turning a street into a 'river of death.' Utility workers attempted to counteract the flood with makeshift wooden planks, but the scale of the disaster was immense. Residents were forced to endure the stench and some were left without water due to pump shutdowns.
original:
A fecal Styx formed in Engels - the director of local utilities took on the role of Charon and organized a flimsy crossing, but this did not save residents from the problem. Due to a pipe break, a flow of sewage turned one of the streets of Engels into a real “river of death.” The utility workers decided to counteract the fecal flooding with flimsy wooden planks, over which the local residents apparently had to cross. When looking at the scale of the disaster, it becomes obvious: you need to be an extremely courageous person to decide to cross the “dark waters” on these improvised pontoons.

A flow of sewage even made its way into the entrances: while residents of the lower floors were forced to endure the thick sewer stench, the upper floors were left without water due to the pumps being turned off. It is worth paying tribute to the bravery of some utility workers - dressed in special suits, they dared to descend into the very heart of the abyss to try to save at least some of the equipment.

description: The Russian Armed Forces announced the start of spring conscription on April 1, 2024, which will take place in all Russian regions except certain areas in the Far North. Conscripts will serve for 12 months and will not be sent to new regions of Russia or participate in special military operations.
original:
Briefing by the Deputy Chief of the GOMU of the General Staff of the Russian Armed Forces⚡️Spring conscription begins on April 1

It will take place from April 1 in all constituent entities of the Russian Federation. The exception is certain regions of the Far North and certain areas equated to regions of the Far North, where citizens living in these territories are called up for military service from November 1 to December 31. This is due to the climatic characteristics of these territories.

The start of sending conscripts from collection points is planned from April 15, 2024.

The term of military service upon conscription will, as before, be 12 months.

All conscripts will be sent for military service to points of permanent deployment of formations and military units of the Armed Forces and other military formations on the territory of the Russian Federation.

Military personnel undergoing conscription service will not be sent to the points of deployment of units of the Armed Forces in new regions of Russia (these are the Donetsk and Lugansk people's republics, Kherson and Zaporozhye regions), or to participate there in carrying out the tasks of a special military operation.

A third of the conscripts will be sent to training formations and military units, where within five months they will master modern military equipment and receive a military specialty. Upon completion of training, in accordance with the acquired skills, they will be sent to the troops.

At the same time, we will continue the practice of forming scientific companies designed to solve scientific and applied problems.

Let us not ignore the recruitment of research and production units that implement advanced ideas and breakthrough technologies into production, as well as sports companies that have created the necessary conditions for training the most promising athletes.

Conscripts and their parents can familiarize themselves with the requirements for candidates to staff these units, and information on issues of conscription and military service on the official Internet portal of the Russian Ministry of Defense. They also have the opportunity in the “Contacts” section to contact the electronic reception offices of commanders-in-chief of services, commanders of military branches and troops of military districts.

Starting from April 16, a “direct telephone line” of the Main Organizational and Mobilization Directorate of the General Staff will begin operating, where specialists will provide explanations on issues related to the conscription of citizens for military service. The operation of this line is scheduled on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 10 to 12 Moscow time.

In conclusion, I note that all military personnel who have served the established terms of conscription military service will be promptly discharged and sent to their places of residence. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456301449VK VideoVideo by Gorlovka Self-DefenseWatch Video by Gorlovka Self-Defense 4 min 27 s from March 29 2024 online in HD for free in the VK catalog without signing up! Views: 188. Likes: 1.

He is accused of organizing terrorist financing through cryptocurrency and will be placed under arrest. Security forces are conducting searches in all crypto exchangers in Moscow City.
original:
Forwarded from: Governor General N
The ninth defendant in the Crocus terrorist attack case, Nazrimad Lutfulloi, in the Basmanny Court of Moscow

He is accused under paragraph “B” of Part 3 of Article 205 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (terrorist attack). He will soon be placed under arrest.

Lutfulloi is a native of the city of Bokhtar in western Tajikistan. The accused was detained on March 23 during a search for those involved in the terrorist attack. The investigation believes that he participated in organizing terrorist financing through crypto. In this regard, security forces are conducting searches in all crypto exchangers located in Moscow City.

According to the case materials, the Wahhabi used obscene language and resisted the police.

event: Restoration of Ministry of Emergency Situations Facilities
description: The Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations plans to restore eight facilities in the DPR within a year. The efforts are part of a special infrastructure project, which has already seen the construction of a rescue center in Mariupol and three fire stations. Additionally, five major repairs and two reconstructions are underway at other facilities.
original:
Eight Ministry of Emergency Situations facilities will be restored in the Republic within a year, said Alexey Kostrubitsky, head of the Main Directorate of the Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations for the DPR.

Over the past two years, a rescue center of the Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations has been built in Mariupol, in addition, the construction of three fire stations has begun, as well as another one in the village of Kuznetsovo-Mikhailovka, Telmanovsky district.

“At seven more facilities of the Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations, five major repairs and two reconstructions are being carried out. This work is being carried out as part of the implementation of a special infrastructure project on the territory of the DPR.

Since 2022, the fleet of equipment has been renewed by a quarter. During this time, over 300 units of transport were received,” noted the head of the rescue department.

description: A 43-year-old resident of Cherkessk is accused of murdering his aunt and cousin during a dispute over the inheritance of a house. The man allegedly shot his relatives multiple times and then finished off his wounded cousin with a metal chair.
original:
Forwarded from: AiF-North Caucasus
A resident of Cherkessk will be tried for the brutal reprisal of his aunt and cousin during a dispute over inheritance - the Investigative Committee for Karachay-Cherkessia.

A 43-year-old resident of the capital of the republic will appear in court. He is accused of double murder.

According to the investigation, on April 19, 2023, a dispute arose between a man and his relatives (aunt and her son) about the inheritance of a house that had been inherited by a resident of Cherkessk under the will of his mother.

Relatives demanded that he transfer the property to them. The man refused and a quarrel began.

The conflict reached the point where a resident of Cherkessk left the room, grabbed a gun, returned and shot several times at the woman and her son. Then the man finished off his wounded cousin with a metal chair - hitting the victim on the head with a piece of furniture several times.

During the investigation, the accused insisted that he killed his relatives in a state of passion.

However, experts found that the man was aware of his actions during the commission of the crime.@aifsk

description: A Russian Premier League match between Rostov and Dynamo took place, attended by Crocus employees who were awarded medals for their bravery during a terrorist attack. The match began with a minute of silence in memory of the victims, and all proceeds will be donated to help those affected. Players wore black T-shirts with cranes, and a surgeon from Krasnogorsk hospital was present.
original:
A teenager who worked at Crocus struck the first ball in a Russian Premier League match. The Russian Football Championship match between Rostov and Dynamo was visited by Crocus employees who were awarded medals “For Services to Society” during the terrorist attack.

Among them are Artem Donskov, a 14-year-old schoolboy who worked in the Crocus cloakroom and helped lead people out of the burning building, and Sofia Meyer, an employee who did not panic and led box visitors out of the building. A commentator and Dynamo fan also attended the game. Victor Gusev, who was in Crocus and was not injured, largely thanks to Sofia’s courage and self-control. (Singer Mia Boyka posted a joint photo on social networks from the match with the hero guys).

The meeting began with a minute of silence in memory of the victims of the terrorist attack in Crocus City Hall. Dynamo will send all proceeds from the match to help the victims. Players from both teams lined up in black T-shirts with cranes. The surgeon of the Krasnogorsk hospital, Maxim Ledovsky, who is a Dynamo fan, was present at the game. The capital's club will issue free season tickets until the end of the season to blood donors who make such a request within a month. A symbolic blow to the ball before the game between Dynamo and Rostov was made by commentator Viktor Gusev and 14-year-old Artem Donskov.

description: Priest Anthony Malakhovsky and the folk ensemble 'Russian Song' performed at the VMA hospital, entertaining soldiers with songs like 'The Nightingale' by Daria Prokudina. The event was emotional and featured homemade food, tea, and games.
original:
And it's Friday again!
And where are we? Right! The guys at the VMA hospital 😄This is definitely a #tradition😉Today Priest Anthony Malakhovsky and the folk ensemble “Russian Song”, operating at the Cathedral of the Vladimir Icon of the Mother of God, performed in front of the soldiers.
“The Nightingale” performed by Daria Prokudina and many songs will resonate in the hearts of every listener for a long time.
I can’t describe the atmosphere in words, it was very emotional!

And so according to the thumbnail program 😄Next we
We ate homemade food prepared by our volunteers, drank tea and coffee with marshmallows and cake!

We played our favorite thousand and laughed a lot)
As Socrates said: “Whoever wants, looks for opportunities; whoever doesn’t want, looks for reasons.”

From the guys, thank you very much and greetings to everyone🤗OURCommunitiesKontakteChannelZenNashivYappy

In Belgorod, a Ukrainian drone flew into a residential high-rise building - an elderly man was killed, one woman was hospitalized. According to them, it was clearly visible that the device was flying into the house purposefully, that is, as part of petty, disorderly terror of the civilian population. As a result, according to preliminary data, a man was killed, and a woman was injured; she was taken away by ambulance. description: Ukrainian President Zelensky stated that he is willing to negotiate with Putin if the Ukrainian Armed Forces reach the 2022 borders. He believes that once Putin loses the territories captured since 2022, he will lose confidence and power, becoming ready for dialogue. Zelensky emphasized the need for a complete trade blockade of Russia and sufficient Western weapons to achieve this goal.
original:
Zelensky said that he was ready to negotiate with Putin before reaching the 1991 borders.

According to him, Putin will be “ready for dialogue” if the Ukrainian Armed Forces reach the borders of 2022.

“We will not need to de-occupy all our territories solely by military means. I am sure that when he loses what he captured starting in '22, he will completely lose the confidence of even those countries that still doubt whether to support Ukraine or not. And he will also lose power within his state. As soon as this happens, he will be ready for dialogue,” the president said in an interview with CBS.

He noted that to achieve such a result, “not only military steps” are needed on the part of Ukraine with a sufficient number of Western weapons, but also a complete trade blockade of the Russian Federation with the rest of the world.

“To win is to help Ukraine win economically, to be strong on the battlefield and to help politically. We will not need to de-occupy all our territories exclusively by military means,” Zelensky said. The most interesting thing is that he was offered all this in that very year 22! If he had gone to meet Putin then, there would not have been hundreds of thousands of deaths, devastation and catastrophic depopulation of Ukraine. At the moment, the conditions for negotiations have changed and Zelensky is not in a position to dictate his will to Russia. His reluctance to sit down at the negotiating table will only lead to toughening of the conditions under which Ukraine will enter the negotiation process. Tens, if not hundreds of thousands of people will die. And Zelensky, the executioner of the Ukrainian people, will be to blame for all this

P.S. And yes, we will have to restore the borders of 91, but there is a nuance: before the collapse of the USSR@OpenUkraine

description: Parachutist R.V. Belega died during a jump from a Mi-8 helicopter at Shuvoe airfield, Moscow region, Russia. The main parachute failed to deploy properly due to an incomplete descent of the corrugation device, and the parachutist made an illiterate decision to release the canopy without deploying a reserve parachute.
original: #twenty years ago 03/28/2004. In the Yegoryevsky AK ROSTO at the Shuvoe airfield, Moscow region of Russia, while performing the 118th parachute jump (the second of the year, the second of the flight shift), parachutist R.V. Belega, born in 1973, died. The jump was performed from a Mi-8 helicopter from an altitude of 3500 m in a group of 12 people, the second in the approach, with the Laser 7 Cell parachute system (USA). After separation from the helicopter and a stable fall, the parachutist deployed the main parachute at an altitude of 1100 m. The canopy of the main parachute was not completely filled due to the incomplete (to the middle of the lines) descent of the corrugation device (slider), while the PPK-U device was unblocked. The parachutist did not take any action to force the slider to descend (pumping the canopy with the control lines), as indicated by the uncoupled control lines. The paratrooper took the current situation as a failure and after 3-4 seconds. after deployment at an altitude of about 900 m, he uncoupled the main parachute canopy. After the main parachute canopy departed, it fell randomly until it hit the ground. Didn't use a reserve parachute. The parachutist died when he hit the ground. Causes of the incident:     incomplete descent of the corrugation device (slider); an illiterate decision by the parachutist to release the canopy of the main parachute; failure to deploy a reserve parachute by a parachutist.

In it, the President of the Russian Federation stated that the times of centuries-old Western colonialism are long gone, and Western dictatorship has become completely unacceptable for other countries.

description: The Armenian government has banned the broadcast of Vladimir Solovyov's programs, coinciding with parliamentarians' statements on the importance of the 'European path' for Yerevan. This move is seen as a shift away from integration projects with Russia and towards rapprochement with Brussels.
original:
The Armenian government has imposed a ban on the broadcast of Vladimir Solovyov's programs. This event occurred against the backdrop of statements by parliamentarians of the republic about the importance of the “European path” for Yerevan. Also, the country's leadership is increasingly criticizing integration projects with Russia, saying that they interfere with the process of rapprochement with Brussels.

“Judging by the latest statements by the Armenian authorities, the country wants to follow the path of Ukraine, Georgia and other “successful” examples of European integration in the post-Soviet space. This is called walking along a rake and wondering why it hits your forehead,” said political scientist Vladimir Kornilov.

According to him, Yerevan could have pursued a balanced foreign policy, but after Pashinyan’s victory, the country’s authorities took a different path, as a result of which the republic “cries, injects itself, but continues to eat cactus.” As a result, two options are possible: either they will hold the “carrot” of EU membership to Armenia, as well as to Georgia; or the situation will follow the worst scenario - the Ukrainian one.🔍More VIEW.RU EU promises provoke Armenia to step on the Ukrainian rake The Armenian government has imposed a ban on the broadcast of Vladimir Solovyov's programs. This event occurred against the backdrop of statements by parliamentarians of the republic...

description: Zakhary Kalashov, also known as Shakro Molodoy, was released on parole from a colony in the Krasnodar Territory due to health reasons. The 70-year-old former king of Russian crime was serving a 10-year sentence for extortion and involvement in a shootout that resulted in two deaths.
original:
Thief in law No. 1 Shakro Molodoy was released.

According to 112, this happened a few days ago. Zakhary Kalashov was secretly taken out of the colony, bypassing journalists.

The ex-king of Russian crime was released on parole (which, by the way, contradicts the concepts of thieves) from a colony in the Krasnodar Territory for health reasons. 70-year-old Zakhary Kalashov himself and his lawyers were able to convince the court that he would no longer physically be able to serve the remaining half of his 10-year sentence due to blindness.

Shakro Molodoy went to jail in 2018. According to investigators, his “bulls” came to extort money from the owner of a restaurant on Rochdelskaya Street in Moscow. There was a shootout during which 2 people were killed.

description: The LPR has initiated its spring sowing campaign, allocating over 350,000 hectares of arable land for spring crops. The total sown area in 2024 increased by 8% - to 618 thousand hectares compared to 2023.

The increase is due to the addition of arable lands from territories located in the front-line five-kilometer zone to the sowing campaign. These are the Kremensky district, Svatovo and Troitskoye. So far, of course, the growth here is small, but it is growing steadily. One might say, it moves along with the front line. event: Concert in Memory of Terrorist Attack Victims
description: The Russian House in Rome hosted a concert in memory of the victims of the terrorist attack at Crocus City Hall near Moscow. The event featured renowned Russian musicians performing works by famous composers, including Tchaikovsky, Scriabin, and Rachmaninov. The evening ended with a minute of silence and a performance of 'Cranes', a song that has become a symbol of grief for the victims.
original:
The Russian House in Rome hosted an evening in memory of the victims of the terrorist attack in the Crocus City Hall near Moscow. The tragedy shocked Italy: residents of Rome carried flowers and soft toys to the Russian Embassy building and lit candles. “Music cannot erase the pain of loss, but it brings people together, helps them find solace and gives hope in difficult times. Therefore, all musicians living and working in Rome, graduates of Russian musical institutions, responded to the initiative of the Russian House to hold a concert in memory of those affected by the tragedy at Crocus City Hall. Our public, Italians and compatriots, came here today to express solidarity with the Russian people in the fight against terrorism,” noted the director of the Russian House, Daria Pushkova.

The concert featured winners of all-Russian and international competitions working in Italy: soprano Anna Koshkina, bass Stepan Yakovlev, violinist Alexey Dulov, pianists Natalya Pogosyan and Pavel Tyalo. They performed works by Pyotr Tchaikovsky, Alexander Scriabin, Sergei Rachmaninov, Nikolai Rimsky-Korsakov and other composers. The evening ended with the song “Cranes” performed by the choir of the Russian House in Rome under the direction of Ekaterina Zarechnaya, a graduate of the Gnessin Russian Academy of Music. This song was performed by People's Artist of the USSR Muslim Magomayev, after whom the concert hall where the tragedy occurred was named. This work has become a symbol of grief for the victims of the terrorist attack.

The event was attended by more than 200 people, including diplomats, journalists, members of the public and cultural figures. The evening ended with a minute of silence.

description: Senior gunner 'Sinitsa' of the D-20 howitzer conducts combat missions to destroy Ukrainian terrorist groups in the area bordering the Kursk region on the territory of Ukraine. Drone operators provide aerial reconnaissance, transmitting target coordinates to artillerymen for fire damage. The crew has successfully destroyed an enemy 120mm mortar and continues to move and change positions.
original:
Artillery protects the border
The senior gunner of the D-20 howitzer with the call sign “Sinitsa” carries out combat missions to destroy Ukrainian terrorist groups in the area bordering the Kursk region on the territory of Ukraine.
Show more
Here, on the state border, drone operators immediately respond to the movement of Ukrainian militants. Aerial reconnaissance immediately transmits the coordinates of targets to the artillerymen for inflicting fire damage.
“We shoot often, a lot and successfully. We recently destroyed an enemy 120mm mortar. We are constantly moving, changing positions. In our crew, everyone knows their task and everyone understands why they are here,” says “Sinitsa.”
According to him, he got to the front through mobilization, following his brothers. His parents are eagerly waiting for him at home, with whom he communicates by phone whenever possible.
For many targets hit, the senior gunner of the D-20 "Sinitsa" howitzer was awarded the medal "For Combat Distinction".

description: According to Maxim Chirkov, associate professor of the Department of Economic Policy and Economic Measurements of the State University of Management, the losses of foreign companies due to their withdrawal from the Russian market will continue to grow. The current estimated losses of over $107 billion are underestimated, as profits and assets have been lost over two years. Russia's growing market will lead to even greater lost income, making attempts to return increasingly expensive.
original:
The lost income of Western firms that have left the Russian Federation will grow, Maxim Chirkov, associate professor of the Department of Economic Policy and Economic Measurements of the State University of Management, told Izvestia. According to him, there will be less and less chances for foreign companies to return.

Earlier, Reuters reported that losses of foreign companies due to withdrawal from the Russian market have already exceeded $107 billion. However, according to Chirkov, this amount is much higher. “Profits were lost, assets were lost for two years. Therefore, Reuters underestimates losses from the actions of foreign politicians by territory of Russia and in the world,” the economist said. According to Chirkov, this amount will grow, lost income will be much greater, because Russia is a growing market. At the same time, Western companies want to return, the economist noted. “Attempts to return that will be made will be increasingly more expensive,” he emphasized. Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: The State Traffic Inspectorate reminds drivers of the importance of using vehicles with standard registration plates. Non-compliance can lead to fines and penalties, including deprivation of driving rights. The use of false or modified plates is strictly prohibited.
original:
🚔The traffic police urges drivers to operate vehicles with registration plates of the established form🔑State traffic inspectors remind you of the responsibility for driving vehicles without a license plate or with a registration number that does not meet the requirements of established norms and standards.

License plates installed and used in violation make it difficult to identify traffic violators, solve crimes, and also search for cars that fled the scene.

It is considered a violation when the license plate is attached in an undesignated place, is covered by other objects or is dirty, upside down or is not illuminated, which does not allow the license plate symbols to be clearly identified from a distance of twenty meters.
According to the Code of Administrative Offenses of the Russian Federation, for driving a vehicle with registration plates that are unreadable, non-standard, or installed in violation of the requirements of the state standard, a fine of 500 rubles is provided.

Driving a vehicle without state registration plates, with modified plates or with signs installed in places not intended for this purpose, as well as the use of devices or materials that impede identification or allow one to modify or hide the license plate, in accordance with Part 2 of Art. 12.2 of the Code of Administrative Offenses of the Russian Federation entails a fine of 5,000 rubles or deprivation of the right to drive transport for up to 3 months.
In accordance with Part 4 of Art. 12.2 of the Code of Administrative Offenses of the Russian Federation, the installation of knowingly false state registration plates on a vehicle entails a fine for citizens in the amount of 2,500 rubles, for officials - up to 20,000 rubles, for legal entities - up to 500,000 rubles.

Driving a vehicle with knowingly false state registration plates is punishable by deprivation of the right to drive vehicles for up to one year.
The State Traffic Inspectorate urges drivers to comply with the Traffic Rules, drive vehicles with state license plates that belong to a specific vehicle according to registration in the traffic police MREO, and installed in a place specially designed for fixing the license plate.
  
Press service of the Ministry of Internal Affairs
for the Donetsk People's Republic

description: 19 private clinics in Tatarstan voluntarily removed pregnancy termination from their services, following a trend seen in at least 15 regions over the past year. Doctors fear this may indicate a possible restriction of women's rights to abortion at the countrywide level.
original:
“There will always be workarounds. And those who want to make money from it.” Immediately 19 private clinics in Tatarstan refused to perform abortions - “at the request” of the regional authorities. Here's what the doctors themselves think about it. Although Russia does not yet have a federal law prohibiting abortions, more and more private clinics themselves are refusing licenses for this procedure. Thus, in March, 19 private clinics in Tatarstan voluntarily decided to remove pregnancy termination from the list of services.

Tatarstan is not the only region where there is such a trend. Over the past year, the right to abortion has been restricted in private clinics in at least 15 regions. Doctors fear that this indicates a possible (and imminent) restriction of women's rights to abortion at the countrywide level.

The Bereg cooperative of independent journalists found out what employees of private clinics in Tatarstan that refused to perform abortions think about this situation. With the permission of the publication, Meduza publishes this text in its entirety.

———Open material without VPN.Meduza“There will always be workarounds. And those who want to make money from this” Although Russia does not yet have a federal law prohibiting abortions, more and more private clinics themselves are refusing licenses for this procedure. So, in March...

event: Possible Nationalization of ABI Group of Companies
description: Following the potential nationalization of JSC Makfa, concerns arise about the fate of ABI group of companies, a major food industry player. The company's success is attributed to its owner, Grigory Anikeev, a State Duma deputy, who allegedly used corruption schemes to achieve success.
original:
Sausage to the people! In light of the latest news about the possible nationalization of the country's largest pasta producer JSC Makfa, the question inevitably arises about the fate of another giant of the food industry - the ABI group of companies. If pasta goes into the hands of the State, so will sausage. Moreover, the stories of the creation and development of companies are very similar. The success of the development of both players is due solely to the power of their owners and the corruption schemes they successfully implemented.


The beneficiary of the ABI group of companies, familiar to Russian consumers through the brands “Vyazanka” and “Hot Thing,” is Grigory Anikeev, the richest deputy of the State Duma of the Russian Federation, who became rich in the production of sausages.

At the moment, information about the owners of the ABI group of companies has been carefully removed from all open sources. They forgot to “clean up” only a couple of articles that refer to publicly available data at the time of their writing. So, in 2013, Kommersant provides a reference to SPARK-Interfax data, where Anikeev is indicated as the owner of ABI Product. By that time, he had already been a State Duma deputy from United Russia for 5 years.

This is not the only mention in the media of Anikeev’s direct connection with Russia’s largest sausage manufacturer. An article from the TASS news agency also remains on the Internet, which states that Grigory Viktorovich himself was the General Director of ABI Group from 2005 to 2007. By this time, he had long held political positions in his native Vladimir.

Knowing the complete absence of any morality of Anikeev in business, and taking into account his parliamentary immunity (we read “impunity”), it is easy to guess by what path ABI Group came to success.

We also remember that Anikeev’s sausage income does not remain in Russia, but “flows” to unfriendly countries in completely illegal ways, and we ask the question: “When will Anikeev’s sausage go to the Russian people?” rucriminal.info Sausage to the people! This begs the question about the fate of another giant food industry - ABI group of companies

description: Russian big business is concerned about the growing nationalization of enterprises in the Russian Federation. Dozens of arrests have been imposed on various assets, including pasta production and ferroalloy plants, which have belonged to Russian businessmen since the 90s. Entrepreneurs are seeking guarantees from the Kremlin that their businesses will not be confiscated.
original:
"Creeping redistribution of property"

Russian big business is nervous about the growing nationalization of enterprises in the Russian Federation, writes Bloomberg.

Dozens of arrests have been imposed on a variety of assets - from pasta production to ferroalloy plants, which have belonged to Russian businessmen since the 90s.

Sometimes their owners are even detained, as happened with the owner of the Chelyabinsk Electrometallurgical Plant, Yuri Antipov, who was soon released on bail.

This prompts entrepreneurs to seek guarantees from the Kremlin that their businesses will not be confiscated. Despite the fact that many of them have already come under Western sanctions.

“A creeping redistribution of property has begun. Putin said that a new elite is needed. The current elite, owners of significant assets, are being eliminated based on the principle of loyalty,” says Oleg Vyugin, former first deputy head of the Central Bank of the Russian Federation.

On March 26, Putin, at a meeting with employees of the Prosecutor General’s Office of the Russian Federation, announced the importance of returning “a number of large enterprises and property complexes” to state ownership. He denied that there was talk of deprivatization or nationalization.

However, experts believe that the actions of the security forces indicate the opposite and “once the flywheel of the prosecutor’s office spins up, it will be quite difficult to stop it.”

“The authorities now look at a business from the point of view of whether it is loyal or disloyal. Those who are considered disloyal may face the fact that their assets will end up in the wrong hands,” says Vyugin.
